meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in competition.
meanings.sent1: The small store outcompeted the big chain by offering lower prices.
meanings.sent2: In the race, the fastest runner outcompeted all the others to win the gold medal.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outcompeted the birds for the last acorn, causing a funny commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outcompeted any obstacles in her path, like a powerful force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the flower outcompeted all the other plants in the garden, drawing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To be more successful than others in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant quickly outcompeted the older ones in town with its delicious food.
meanings.sent2: The talented team outcompeted their rivals to win the championship trophy.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outcompeted the other animals in the forest by finding the most food.
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas outcompeted the traditional methods, revolutionizing the industry.
meanings.sent5: The bright student outcompeted her classmates in the science fair, impressing the judges with her project.
